snippet: A move by the Culture Ministry that reflects the rise of hard-liners through all segments of the Iranian government.
abstract: Iran's Culture Ministry formally dissolves the House of Cinema, the only domestic organization that supports independent film, replacing it with a committee that will stick to Islamic guidelines and politically permissible topics; move reflects the rise of hard-liners through all segments of the Iranian government.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ARTIN AFKHAMI
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Artin Afkhami from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: A move by the Culture Ministry that reflects the rise of hard-liners through all segments of the Iranian government.

headline.main: Iran’s Leaders Shut Down Independent Film Group
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Leaders Shut Down Independent Film Group

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
